snippet.textDisplay: The last level and boss run in this game capped off an absolutely fantastic game experiences, considering I bought the game because I was bored on a Saturday and all my friends were either working or busy.

snippet.textDisplay: I remember when this game first came out on gamecube and everyone i knew who played it said it was awesome. So about 6 months ago i decided to buy the game online and play it on my nintendo wii since i dont have a gamecube. All i can say is that this game is my second favorite mario game of all time next to super mario 64. The whole storyline was epic and the gameplay was awesome, too.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember when this game first came out on gamecube and everyone i knew who played it said it was awesome. So about 6 months ago i decided to buy the game online and play it on my nintendo wii since i dont have a gamecube. All i can say is that this game is my second favorite mario game of all time next to super mario 64. The whole storyline was epic and the gameplay was awesome, too.

snippet.textDisplay: I got a great story to tell! So I was replaying this game for the millionth time and I got to Shadow Queen. She has enough health left where I can kill her in one Super Bounce. All my partners are dead. I have one health. And I beat her. Probably the most intense action I've ever had to make in an RPG. This is probably my favorite game of all time. I'm in the middle of the first one and it is also a ton of fun. Let's hope the next game in the series is as good as this one.
snippet.textOriginal: I got a great story to tell! So I was replaying this game for the millionth time and I got to Shadow Queen. She has enough health left where I can kill her in one Super Bounce. snippet.textDisplay:
I think the main reason is that the game is not an RPG like the first two. But I thought it was very well done,the gameplay was good and the story was surprsingly deep for a Mario game.

I mean,it was different,but it went all the way with it, it was a pretty complete game,unlike Sticker Star,which was a dumbed down version of the first two. I was really pissed when Nintendo ruined the opportunity for a awesome new RPG Paper Mario for a console,and then still made Mario & Luigi 4 for the 3DS.
snippet.textOriginal:
I think the main reason is that the game is not an RPG like the first two. But I thought it was very well done,the gameplay was good and the story was surprsingly deep for a Mario game.

I was really pissed when Nintendo ruined the opportunity for a awesome new RPG Paper Mario for a console,and then still made Mario & Luigi 4 for the 3DS.

snippet.textDisplay:
I absolutely adore this game,and this theme is great. I still remember how the entire game was easy,but then the Shadow Queen just kicked my ass a bunch of times. I had to go back and level up on the Pit of a 100 Trials. 

Also,I still remember how I was a little scared of this,I played as a kid,and thought it was pretty dark for a Mario game. A demon possessing Peach,all those black fire candles and shit,and this intense music? Geez.
snippet.textOriginal:
I absolutely adore this game,and this theme is great. I still remember how the entire game was easy,but then the Shadow Queen just kicked my ass a bunch of times. I had to go back and level up on the Pit of a 100 Trials.

snippet.textDisplay: Is it just me or does this track have a distinctly darker sound than what one would normally expect from a Mario game? I know that the Paper Mario series has had its fair share of sinister and intensely grim music but, I have to say that this is probably my favorite track out of all of them.
snippet.textOriginal: Is it just me or does this track have a distinctly darker sound than what one would normally expect from a Mario game? I know that the Paper Mario series has had its fair share of sinister and intensely grim music but, I have to say that this is probably my favorite track out of all of them.

snippet.textDisplay: I probably spent 80% of my time back then playing PS2 games, my favorite console of its generation, but with a list like this one where it's about amazing (not just great) games, the couple diamonds on the GC definitely earn some spots in my Top 30. The PS2 would probably have tons of games in my Top 100.

snippet.textDisplay: A lot of people really love this track and I never understood why. It's pretty alright, definitely not bad, but as far as Paper Mario goes, my heart belongs to Flipside.

snippet.textDisplay: It's interesting to me that the Gamecube is getting a lot of representation in this top 30 list of yours. This is the third game already, and I'm betting that Metroid Prime will appear at some point as well. The GC is generally regarded as one of the weaker among major consoles. I was expecting plenty of SNES-N64, but not that much GC. Not that I'm complaining; I like the GC.
snippet.textOriginal: It's interesting to me that the Gamecube is getting a lot of representation in this top 30 list of yours. This is the third game already, and I'm betting that Metroid Prime will appear at some point as well. The GC is generally regarded as one of the weaker among major consoles. I was expecting plenty of SNES-N64, but not that much GC. Not that I'm complaining; I like the GC.

snippet.textDisplay: I like how Nintendo went with the main composers from its 2 strategy games: Yoshito Hirano (Advance Wars) and Yuka Tsujiyoko (Fire Emblem). I actually discovered that yesterday when listening to this track, it hit me how similar to some darker Advance Wars themes it sounds. It's definitely Hirano's work! I remember having a super hard time with the Shadow Queen.
snippet.textOriginal: I like how Nintendo went with the main composers from its 2 strategy games: Yoshito Hirano (Advance Wars) and Yuka Tsujiyoko (Fire Emblem). I actually discovered that yesterday when listening to this track, it hit me how similar to some darker Advance Wars themes it sounds. It's definitely Hirano's work! I remember having a super hard time with the Shadow Queen.

snippet.textDisplay: My favorite Mario RPG, this game is close to perfect in my book. With all its chapters, the game offers extremely varied gameplay, audiovisual design and atmosphere. Rogueport and its underground is also an awesome main hub. I also really like the challenge in this game (damn you, Pit of 100 Trials!). My favorite chapters were Glitzville's arena and the train, but I loved most of them (Twilight Town, Moon, Pirates, etc.).
snippet.textOriginal: My favorite Mario RPG, this game is close to perfect in my book. With all its chapters, the game offers extremely varied gameplay, audiovisual design and atmosphere. Rogueport and its underground is also an awesome main hub. I also really like the challenge in this game (damn you, Pit of 100 Trials!). My favorite chapters were Glitzville's arena and the train, but I loved most of them (Twilight Town, Moon, Pirates, etc.).
